english: sink fish; fish dive; beauty that makes fish dive; stunning beauty

etymology.description: 沉(sink) + 鱼(fish) = fish sink/dive; by extension, beauty so stunning that fish dive to hide.
etymology.interpretation: Literally describes fish diving under the water; metonymic abbreviation of the idiom 沉鱼落雁, praising breathtaking female beauty, traditionally linked with Xīshī.
etymology.simplification: 魚 → 鱼 to reduce strokes; 沉 unchanged. The word simplifies because of the 魚 component.

examples.chinese: 她有沉鱼之貌(她有沉魚之貌)。
examples.english: She has beauty that makes fish dive.

examples.chinese: 西施常被称为“沉鱼”，源自成语“沉鱼落雁”(西施常被稱為「沉魚」，源自成語「沉魚落雁」。)
examples.pinyin: Xīshī cháng bèi chēng wèi “chényú”, yuánzì chéngyǔ “chényú luòyàn”.
examples.english: Xishi is often labeled “chenyu,” from the idiom “fish sink, geese fall.”

examples.chinese: 炮声一响，湖中沉鱼，水面立刻安静下来(炮聲一響，湖中沉魚，水面立刻安靜下來)。
examples.pinyin: Pàoshēng yī xiǎng, hú zhōng chényú, shuǐmiàn lìkè ānjìng xiàlái.
examples.english: At the bang of the cannon, the fish in the lake dived and the surface quickly grew still.
